name: Rally. Rally? Rally!
description:
The two main political parties have been trading blows for months, demonizing each other, both manufacturing consent and suppressing dissent on their way to the top of the polls, despite their policies being almost identical.

The voting takes place over multiple days. The first few days saw the incumbent Conservative Party take the lead, but if the Democratic Party wins the final, largest district, the presidency is theirs.

You play as the Democratic candidate's assistant, as you frantically try to influence voters and secure a Democratic victory on the last day of the election.
As a sizable amount of voters of this particular country are quite fickle, influencing their opinions will prove to be simple, but not everyone is so easily swayed.
Everything is on the table, from lying about healthcare to concentration camps for immigrants, from capitalist propaganda to imperialist policies that would raise eyes in the court of Caligula: anything to get the necessary votes to get to power.

______________________________

This game was developed using Godot 3.2.3

A number of intended features (including audio) had to be cut due to time constraints, but they will be implemented post-jam.
